attributes.action: devolve powers similar to those employed by the Welsh assembly to the English regions and the county of Cornwall.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The U.K. should evolve by adopting a federal system of government in which 7 regional councils would be set up with the same powers as those issued to the Welsh assembly. Westminster would relate to the councils in the same way as it dose with the existing Welsh assembly. The councils would be elected every 5 years. 

Note that London’s mayor is excluded and will remain untouched by this petition.



The councils would cover theses regions- 

1/Cornwall-  Cornwall.

2/East Anglia- East Anglia (including Essex).

3/Northumbria- The traditional county of Northumbria.

4/Northern England- Yorkshire and Humberside/North West England/the Traditional county of Durham-shire.

5/The English Midlands- East Midlands/West Midlands/Greater Birmingham.

6/The Isle of Wight- The Isle of Wight.

7/Southern England- South East England and South West England (excluding Cornwall, The Isle of Wight and Essex).

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Federalism/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
